    Maps & Directions



Chapman University is fortunate to call sunny Southern California its home. Located on two beautiful campuses in Orange County, we are close to both booming industries for career opportunities and world-class hot spots to fill your adventurous side.  

View Interactive Campus Map

View Campus Map (PDF)


View Rinker Health Science Interactive Campus Map (in Irvine, CA) 

View Rinker Health Science Campus Map (PDF)



If you're visiting as a prospective student, your journey begins in the Pankey Visitor Center in the main lobby of Argyros Forum. 
You will need Adobe Reader to view the PDFs





Planning on paying us a visit?
Acquaint yourself with the local area before you get here with these resources:
Dining options on campus and nearby
Lodging close to campus
Things to do on campus and in the local area





Toggle Section





                                                Driving Directions to Main Campus (Orange)

                                            

Chapman University, Orange campus, is nestled in the heart of Southern California. The campus is located in the historic district of Old Towne Orange, one of the oldest residential communities in Orange County.
Use Google Driving Directions

PLEASE NOTE: Glassell Avenue, both North and South of the Plaza, are closed due to Covid adjustments. Detours are in place to navigate around the main streets. 

From the North

Take 5 Freeway SOUTH
Exit onto 22 Freeway EAST, Orange
Take 22 Freeway EAST to Glassell St. Exit
Exit on Glassell St., turn NORTH (left off the freeway exit ramp)
Take Glassell St. NORTH to traffic circle
Exit the second exit of the traffic circle (Glassell St. NORTH)
Take Glassell St. NORTH to One University Drive 
Turn right on Walnut Ave. for campus parking in the Anderson Underground Parking Structure
Refer to the campus map for building directions and other parking locations

From Los Angeles International Airport (LAX) and West Los Angeles

Take 405 Freeway SOUTH
Exit onto 22 Freeway EAST
Take 22 Freeway EAST to Glassell St. Exit
Exit on Glassell St., turn NORTH (left off the freeway exit ramp)
Take Glassell St. NORTH to traffic circle
Exit the second exit of the traffic circle (Glassell St. NORTH)
Take Glassell St. NORTH to One University Drive
Turn right on Walnut Ave. for campus parking in the Anderson Underground Parking Structure
Refer to the campus map for building directions and other parking locations

From John Wayne/Orange County Airport (SNA)

Exit airport, turn left on MacArthur Blvd.
Take the 405 Freeway NORTH (stay to the right)
Exit onto 55 NORTH to Chapman Avenue Orange
Turn WEST on Chapman Avenue (right off freeway exit ramp)
Take Chapman Avenue West to traffic circle (Glassell St.)
Exit the first exit of the traffic circle (Glassell St. NORTH)
Take Glassell St. NORTH to One University Drive
Turn right on Walnut Ave. for campus parking in the Anderson Underground Parking Structure
Refer to the campus map for building directions and other parking locations

From the South

Take 5 Freeway NORTH 
Exit onto 55 Freeway NORTH
Take 55 Freeway NORTH to Chapman Avenue Orange
Turn WEST on Chapman Avenue (right off the freeway exit ramp)
Take Chapman Avenue WEST to traffic circle (Glassell St.)
Exit the first exit of the traffic circle (Glassell St. NORTH)
Take Glassell St. NORTH to One University Drive
Turn right on Walnut Ave. for campus parking in the Anderson Underground Parking Structure
Refer to the campus map for building directions and other parking locations

From the East

Take 15 Freeway SOUTH
Exit onto 91 Freeway WEST (Beach Cities)
Take 91 Freeway WEST to 55 Freeway SOUTH
Exit onto 55 Freeway SOUTH (left lane exit)
Take 55 Freeway SOUTH to Chapman Avenue
Exit onto Chapman Avenue
Turn WEST on Chapman Avenue (right off the freeway exit ramp)
Take Chapman Avenue WEST to traffic circle (Glassell St.)
Exit the first exit of the traffic circle (Glassell St. NORTH)
Take Glassell St. NORTH to One University Drive
Turn right on Walnut Ave. for campus parking in the Anderson Underground Parking Structure
Refer to the campus map for building directions and other parking locations







                                                Driving Directions to Rinker Health Science Campus (Irvine)

                                            

From I-5 North

Merge onto I-5 North
Use the right 2 lanes to take exit 92B for I-405 N/I-5 N/Bake Pkwy toward Long Beach
Use the right lane to stay on Exit 92B and follow signs for Bake Pkwy
Use the right 2 lanes to turn right onto Bake Pkwy
Continue on Bake Pkwy.  Drive to Jeronimo Rd.
Turn left onto Jeronimo Rd.
Rinker Health Science Campus will on the right, just before Alton Pkwy.

 
From I-5 South

Merge onto I-5 SOUTH
Use the right lane to take exit 94 for Alton Parkway
Merge onto Enterprise Dr.
Use the right 2 lanes to turn right onto Alton Parkway (signs for I-5 NORTH/Los Angeles)
Take Alton Parkway to Jeronimo Road
Turn right onto Jeronimo Road
Rinker Health Science Campus will on the immediate left.







                                                What Visitors Need to Know about Parking

                                            

Chapman Parking Map (PDF)
Visitors Parking Map (PDF)
RegulationsAll parking areas are restricted 24 hours-per-day, seven days-per-week. During restricted hours all vehicles must display a valid parking permit. You must purchase a short-term parking permit unless you have received a pass in advance.
Where to ParkThe West Campus Structure accessed via N. Cypress Street or the Marion Knott Studios Lot at Palm and Lemon. After 4 p.m. Monday-Thursday and all-day Friday-Sunday, visitors may also park in the Barrera Structure at Sycamore and Lemon and the Anderson Structure located off Walnut between Glassell and Center.
Permits at Marion Knott Studios LotVisitors may park in any unreserved space in the lot. Temporary permits are required and may be purchased from the permit dispenser located in the rear parking area. Be sure to place the permit face-up on your dashboard.
Permits in Barrera StructureVisitors may only park after 4 p.m.. Monday – Thursday and all day Friday - Sunday in any unreserved space. Visitor permits are required at all times and may be purchased from one of the parking kiosks located on levels 1 and 3 in the north east corner by the elevator. You can purchase a permit via the Pay-and-Display option which requires the printed permit to be displayed on the dash of the vehicle or via the Pay-by-Plate option which requires you to enter your license plate but does not require a paper permit to be displayed on the vehicle.
Permits in Anderson StructureVisitors may park in the 50 marked visitor spaces on the first floor prior to 4pm, and in any unreserved space after 4 p.m. Monday – Thursday and all day Friday – Sunday. Visitor permits are required at all times and may be purchased from one of the parking kiosks located in the structure: NW corner, elevator lobby on the south end levels B1 and B2, middle of the east wall level B1, or in the extension near the elevator that leads into the Keck Science center. You can purchase a permit via the Pay-and-Display option which requires the printed permit to be displayed on the dash of the vehicle or via the Pay-by-Plate option which requires you to enter your license plate but does not require a paper permit to be displayed on the vehicle.
Cost$2 for 2 hours; $3 for 4 hours; $5 for 12 hours.
City StreetsThe streets adjacent to campus are reserved for Orange resident-only permit parking. The affected blocks are marked with red and white signs. It is likely that you will be ticketed by the City of Orange if you park in one of these areas. Curb-side parking is allowed only on the campus side of the University perimeter.
QuestionsCall Parking Services at (714) 997-6560 or email at transportation@chapman.edu






                                                Bus Directions/Arrival Instructions

                                            

At Chapman, we always strive to be good neighbors. We recognize and acknowledge the fact that our campus is located within a unique and historic residential district, and as such, not all neighboring streets are approved for commercial vehicle use.
Please kindly review and adhere to the bus arrival instructions below. Thank you in advance for your cooperation. We look forward to your visit!

Driving Directions from Major Freeways
Arriving from the 22 (Garden Grove Freeway)

Exit Glassell St.
Go North, and processed through the Orange Plaza(Traffic Circle), continuing on Glassell St.
Once you pass University Dr./Sycamore Ave., the Passenger Loading curb will be on the right-hand side of Glassell St. parallel to the Musco Center of the Arts 

Arriving from the 57 (Orange Freeway)

Exit W Chapman Ave. in Orange (exit 1D). 
Continue on W Chapman Ave. heading east 
At the traffic circle, take the third exit onto Glassell St.
Once you pass University Dr./Sycamore Ave., the Passenger Loading curb will be on the right-hand side of Glassell St. parallel to the Musco Center of the Arts 

Arriving from the 55 (Costa Mesa/Newport Freeway)

Exit W Chapman Ave.
Go one mile to the Orange Plaza (traffic circle)
Turn right onto Glassell St. and go north
Once you pass University Dr./Sycamore Ave., the Passenger Loading curb will be on the right-hand side of Glassell St. parallel to the Musco Center of the Arts 


Bus Drop-Off Zone
All loading and unloading of buses must be done in the properly marked loading zone on Glassell Street, just west of the Musco Center. Please input 401 N. Glassell Street into your GPS for easiest navigation. 


Bus Waiting Area
While your group is on campus, short term bus parking is available in the Palm Ave. Lot.
From the designated bus drop-off zone: Proceed N on Glassell St. Turn left at the 1st cross street onto W Walnut Ave, then turn left onto N Batavia St. Turn left onto W Palm Ave and turn right at the signal for Depot Parking. Please input 502 W. Palm Avenue into your GPS for easiest navigation. 
Drivers must stay with their buses at all times. 
 
When you are ready to return back to campus to pick up your passengers, please use the following route: Take Palm Ave east to Glassell St. and make a left. The loading zone will be on your right just past Sycamore Ave.
